name: King Size bed frame and mattress
description: Client, 26 years old is married with 2 children (7y/o and 3y/o). Her husband is current sole breadwinner as client is pregnant in her last trimester. Family managed to get a 2-room rental flat but does not have financial resources to purchase home furniture. Family usually sleeps on same bed. They hope to receive item before baby is born in 2024.

name: Single size bedsheet
description:
Client is a 57 man who has low IQ and is living with his sister. 
He has a conflictual relationship with his sister and thus she does not financially support him. 
He has been sleeping on the floor for a long time and would benefit from having a mattress, pillow and bolster, especially during this period when he is having some health issue.

name: Wardrobe
description: Family of 9 requires a wardrobe as their existing wardrobe is in a bad condition. Father is the sole breadwinner as mother needs to care for the children and currently unable to work. Family has tight financial situation and are under financial assistance. Family is unable to afford to get a replacement.

name: Mattress
description:
Needy elderly M/78, staying alone in Bedok. Require a new mattress, size super single (existing bed frame). As the old mattress is already damaged/torn, and is hurting his back.
The client has multiple medical conditions, a cancer survival, and is required to manage multiple chronic diseases too. 
Hope to receive a 6 to 8 inches thickness mattress, so that the existing bedsheet does not have to change due to the different sizes of the mattress. Thank you.

name: Stacking rack
description:
Client is on long-term MC for 6 months, husband is the only sole breadwinner. The family consist of 8 members with 6 school-going children aged between 6 to 14. 
The family is currently receiving insufficient finance support. Client is working towards self-reliance to resume her online baking business for additional income to support family finances.

name: Queen size mattress

name: Sofa Bed
description: Client is a single mother taking care of her 6 daughters and 2 grandchildren below aged 2yo. The family is currently living in a 3-room purchased flat. Due to strained relationships with her ex-husband, he had locked the master bedroom and disallowed the family members from using the room. As a result, the family of 9 only has 2 beds to sleep on. Client has requested for a sofa bed so that her children are able to sleep more comfortably at night, and is able to convert to a sofa to save space when not in use.

name: Single-size double decker bedframe and mattresses
description:
Please indicate only relevant details necessary for this PIO request.

Client and her husband are married with 6 children. Client’s husband is the sole breadwinner for the family and earning an average monthly income of S$1900. Client has not been able to work due to her caregiving responsibilities for their two young special needs children. 

The family are currently sleeping with their mattresses on the floor as they could not afford to buy a bedframe. Their existing mattresses have become saggy which they often waking up having body aches. In addition, client has been having difficulties to get up from the mattress as she recently sprained her leg. 

In view of the reasons above, we would like to request for a queen size bed and mattress for client & husband as well as a single size double decker bed and mattresses for client’s kids.

name: bunk bed
description: Client is currently living with her elder daughter. Her younger daughter comes back from the children's home every weekend to spend time with them, but recently the home found out that the 2 daughters are sleeping together with the elder daughter's boyfriend over the weekends. Requesting for a bunk bed for them so the younger daughter can have her own space and prevent risk. Rental flat (GT)

name: Food ration
description:
Requesting halal food rations for needy families who may not have money to buy food Items due to financial issues Items needed such as

- Halal Can Food [Meat - Sardine/Chicken etc] / [Vegetarian – Corn/Mushroom etc]
- Bags of Rice ( 2/5 kg)
- Assorted Packet of Maggi Noodles [Chicken/Curry/Vegetarian]
- Packets of Bee hoon (Chilli Brand)
- Packets of Assorted Biscuits (example: Khong guan biscuits / Jacob)
- Packets of 3-in-1 beverage (Milo/Horlicks/tea/coffee)

- Packets of Salt & Sugar
- Soya Sauce (Light / Dark)
- Evaporated Milk


Any amount is appreciated! Please call / email me before making any purchase as we have space constraint issues. Thank you!

name: Sennheiser G4 Lavalier Kit
description:
The Helping Hand is reaching out with a heartfelt appeal for your support towards our mission of transforming lives through our Rehabilitation and Reintegration Programme.

Our work is centered around empowering individuals on their journey towards positive change and reintegration into society. Each day, we witness incredible stories of resilience, determination, and transformation among those in our program. These stories are not just moments; they are powerful testaments to the potential for change and hope in every individual.

To effectively capture and share these invaluable narratives, we require critical media equipment. A Sennheiser G4 Lavalier Kit will allow us to capture clear and crisp audio, ensuring that every testimony and conversation is heard with clarity and dignity. 

Your generous donation towards this cause will directly contribute to our ability to share these narratives effectively. By supporting our media equipment appeal, you are not just investing in cameras and microphones; you are investing in the lives of individuals striving to rebuild, overcome obstacles, and contribute positively to society.

We invite you to be part of this impactful journey by contributing to our media equipment fund. Your generosity will play a pivotal role in our ability to amplify these stories of hope, resilience, and transformation. Please support cause. Every contribution, regardless of size, is immensely appreciated and brings us one step closer to our goal.

Thank you for considering our appeal and for your unwavering support in our mission to empower lives and build a better future for all.

name: Milk Powder - Lactogen 3

The family of 5 would require wet food rations so that they are able to meet their basic daily needs. There is only one sole breadwinner  currently and mother is not working due to providing high caregiving to the three children.

name: Food ration
description:
Requesting halal food rations for needy families who may not have money to buy food Items due to financial issues Items needed such as

- Halal Can Food [Meat - Sardine/Chicken etc] / [Vegetarian – Corn/Mushroom etc]
- Bags of Rice ( 2/5 kg)
- Assorted Packet of Maggi Noodles [Chicken/Curry/Vegetarian]
- Packets of Bee hoon (Chilli Brand)
- Packets of Assorted Biscuits (example: Khong guan biscuits / Jacob)
- Packets of 3-in-1 beverage (Milo/Horlicks/tea/coffee)
- Bottle of Cooking oil (1L)
- Packets of Salt & Sugar
- Soya Sauce (Light / Dark)
- Evaporated Milk


Any amount is appreciated! Please call / email me before making any purchase as we have space constraint issues. Thank you!

name: Ipad
description: The client has a 19-year-old son who requires an iPad for his internship. The client is facing significant financial difficulties and is unable to work due to his health issues. Hence, client is unable to afford an ipad for his son.

name: Paint
description: Family of 9 living in a 2-room rental flat request for 2 pails of paint (10 litres) for their new rental flat. The only sole breadwinner is the grandmother who works on ad hoc. The mother is a full-time mother taking are of 5 schooling children and 1 baby. The grandfather helps to take care of the children. The extra coat of paint would help to cover  up the wear and tear of the wall and improve the ambience of the new rental flat.

name: Anlene Powder Milk (Gold 5X)

name: Transportation Services/Drivers
description:
We have 2 Deaf Children (3yo and 4yo) who are looking for drivers/transportation services in 2024 to ferry them from Home to SADeaf and back so that they may attend the Little Hands Bilingual Bicultural Programme (LHBBP) at SADeaf to prepare them for Primary school. 

The details of the service are as follows: 

5 days a week, Monday to Friday

Morning
815 to 830am: Pick Up at Yishun area,
9am: Reach SADeaf for LHBBP

Afternoon
1230pm: Pick up from SADeaf and drop off at Yishun area for childcare/school

Let me know if this service is something you’ll be interested in or are willing to provide for this family. We are also sourcing funding to assist the family with paying for this service as well. You may reach out to me at 97917566, and we can discuss the arrangements further.

contact.org: The Singapore Association For The Deaf (SADeaf)

name: Microwave
description: Client (23M) is living in a rental flat with an assigned flatmate. As of August 2023, there had been conflicts and the tension between the two remains high. His flatmate has also restricted client’s use of certain appliances in the home such as the stove and cookware as these were purchased by his flatmate. Client was recently suspected to have Celiac Disease, which has dietary limitations. However, due to his financial instability, client has been eating instant noodles at the expense of his own health. Client has requested for a microwave so that he can incorporate more nutritious, ready-to-eat meals that are more suitable for his dietary restrictions.

name: Washing Machine

She hopes for a washing machine so that he can maintain hygiene standards and no longer have to wash their clothes by hands. As she was staying in relative's place, they do not have their own.

name: Freestyle Comfort Oxygen Concentrator
description: Client is has cancer patient and under our palliative care service. She hopes to get this lightweight oxygen concentrator to be able to go out with her family and friends on longer outings as these are precious quality time to her and activities she used to enjoy and really looked forward to in the past as a cancer patient for several years.  She is unable to go out for longer period of time now due to breathlessness and having to be dependent on oxygen machine as the cancer has progressed; currently, she has to bring a portable oxygen tank out which is heavy and can only last for 3 hours (has to be refilled and replaced once oxygen is used up).  This lightweight o2 concentrator can be charged and need not be refilled and replaced. She and family have difficulties affording a light weight oxygen concentrator as it is costly. Hence they are hoping to get it second hand. Refer to https://shop.lifelinecorp.com/products/freestyle-comfort-portable-oxygen-concentrator for reference Kindly contact Amanda at 84282545.

name: Adult diapers, Brand: LifreeType: Powerful pants. Size: L16
description: Client is living with her husband and 3 children. Both client and husband are working to support the family, and is marginally sufficient. Client has to provide for eldery father's needs as well and will benefit from adult diapers for her elderly father.

name: quad tip base walking stick

My senior has unsteady gait and has falls due to SOB and giddiness. 

She would need a quad stick with a small tip to prevent tripping on the walking stick itself while preserving the sturdiness of the walking aid. 

The walking stick should be adjustable in height as well.

name: Personal Mobility Device
description: Client is currently unemployed as he is suffering from epilepsy. Over the last few months, he has been having fits where he would have uncontrollable jerking, shaking, lose awareness and stare blankly into space before he was brought to the hospital. Client is divorced and staying by himself. He is fully dependent on the financial assistance provided by the Social Service Office for his sustenance. Client is hoping to get a personal mobility device from donation so that he can use it to work as a food deliveryman and earn some income.

name: Wheelchair
description: Client's husband (M/48) has a history of multiple health issues.(obesity hyperventilation syndrome, obstructive sleep apnea, chronic hypertension, gout and diabetes), he was also in Feb 2023 admitted into SGH for water retention issues in his calves, which is a symptom of an infected liver. His current wheelchair is too small for his use. A bigger wheelchair would be most beneficial.

name: Wheelchair (abit larger in size) (URGENT!)
description:
Client is a 73-year-old elderly man with mental health condition who requires a wheelchair.
Client has several health conditions that limit his movement hence, he normally uses a wheelchair when going to medical appointments.
Client's old wheelchair was recently damaged and he needed a new/donated one.
The new/ donated wheelchair will also lighten his wife's work as caretaker. The wheelchair has to be abit larger in size as client is about 73kg.
Appreciate Delivery arrangements to be done and covered by donor. Interested donors please WHATSAPP / EMAIL me. Thank you!

Client is now discharged and recovering at home but needs a wheelchair which she cannot afford. Client is obese with health conditions, hence she will need a wheelchair that can support her weight.
